attractions.name: Laguna Azul
attractions.description: A beautiful crystal-clear lagoon surrounded by lush vegetation. Ideal for swimming, boating, and enjoying local cuisine on its shores.

details.hours: Open daily from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM
details.price: Entrance fee: S/. 10 (Peruvian Soles) per person
details.tips: Bring sunscreen, swimwear, and cash for local food vendors. Weekdays are less crowded than weekends.

attractions.name: Ahuashiyacu Waterfall
attractions.description: An impressive 40-meter high waterfall located in the middle of the jungle. A refreshing destination to escape the tropical heat.

details.hours: Open daily from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM
details.price: Entrance fee: S/. 15 (Peruvian Soles) per person
details.tips: The trail can be slippery during rainy season. Wear appropriate footwear and bring a change of clothes if you plan to swim.

attractions.name: Urku Amazonian Studies
attractions.description: Cultural center that promotes Amazonian art and traditions. Offers exhibitions, workshops, and sales of local handicrafts.

details.hours: Monday to Saturday: 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM, Closed on Sundays
details.price: Entrance fee: S/. 8 (Peruvian Soles) per person, Workshops: S/. 20-50 (Peruvian Soles)
details.tips: Check their schedule for special events and workshops. Many handicrafts make excellent souvenirs.

attractions.name: Cordillera Escalera Reserve
attractions.description: Protected area with rich biodiversity. Home to numerous species of birds, mammals, and endemic plants of the region.

details.hours: Tours available from 6:00 AM to 3:00 PM
details.price: Guide services: S/. 80-150 (Peruvian Soles) depending on tour length
details.tips: Hiring a local guide is highly recommended. Early morning tours offer the best wildlife viewing opportunities.

attractions.name: Plaza de Armas of Tarapoto
attractions.description: The heart of the city where locals and tourists gather. Surrounded by restaurants, shops, and historic buildings.

details.tips: Visit in the evening when locals come out to socialize. The area is well-lit and safe for evening strolls.

attractions.name: Chanka Museum
attractions.description: Museum exhibiting artifacts and art from indigenous cultures of the Amazon region, including ceramics, textiles, and traditional tools.

details.hours: Tuesday to Sunday: 9:00 AM to 4:00 PM, Closed on Mondays
details.price: Entrance fee: S/. 5 (Peruvian Soles) per person
details.tips: Guided tours are available in Spanish and sometimes in English. Photography may be restricted in certain areas.

attractions.name: San Mateo Hot Springs
attractions.description: Natural hot springs with medicinal properties, surrounded by lush tropical vegetation. A perfect place to relax.

details.hours: Open daily from 7:00 AM to 9:00 PM
details.price: Entrance fee: S/. 12 (Peruvian Soles) per person
details.tips: Bring a towel and change of clothes. The springs are less crowded early in the morning and on weekdays.

attractions.name: Tarapoto Market
attractions.description: Colorful local market where you can find regional products, exotic fruits, handicrafts, and authentic Amazonian cuisine.

details.hours: Monday to Saturday: 6:00 AM to 6:00 PM, Sunday: 6:00 AM to 2:00 PM
details.tips: Best visited in the morning when produce is freshest. Try local fruits like camu camu, cocona, and aguaje. Bargaining is expected for non-food items.
